title: Sri Lanka secures two Bronze medals
byline: Sri Lanka’s Kalinga Kumarage secured the bronze medal in the Men’s 400 metre event on the second day of the 26th Asian Senior Athletic Championships, which continued in Gumi, South Korea.

title: Deshabandu links cops to drug mafia
byline: The ongoing investigation into the Weligama incident is primarily based on evidence submitted by supporters of the National People’s Power (NPP) party, according to Sanjeewa Weerawickrama, legal counsel for Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennekoon. He conveyed this during proceedings before the special commission probing allegations against the IGP.

title: Trump administration to ’aggressively’ revoke visas of Chinese students
byline: US President Donald Trump’s administration says it will ’’aggressively’’ revoke the visas of Chinese students studying in the US.

title: US trade court blocks Trump’s sweeping tariffs
byline: A US federal court has blocked President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, in a major blow to a key part of his economic policies.

title: BYD EV demand in Sri Lanka “exceeds expectations”: JKH
byline: The Sri Lankan appetite for electric mobility is accelerating faster than anticipated, with over 5,000 BYD vehicles reserved since the brand’s entry into the market earlier this year, John Keells Holdings (JKH) said this week.

title: Showers, strong winds and rough seas forecast around the island; Fisherfolk urged to remain vigilant
byline: The Meteorology Department today issued a marine weather advisory warning of showers, thundershowers, and rough sea conditions around several coastal areas of the island, urging naval and fishing communities to exercise extreme caution.

title: Sri Lankans spend Rs.520 million per day on cigarettes
byline: In lieu of the upcoming World No Tobacco day, a study revealed that Sri Lankans spend Rs. 520 million per day on cigarettes and the health and economic costs of smoking were Rs.214 billion in 2019, the Alcohol and drug information Centre (ADIC) in a media briefing about tobacco habits said.

title: Govt. eyes long-term plan to tackle export sector challenges
byline: The government is looking to craft a longterm industrial development plan as Sri Lanka is moving towards establishing itself as an export-led economy, the President’s Office said.

title: Wind power projects essential despite minimal environmental impact: SLSEA Chief
byline: While wind power projects are hailed as a cleaner alternative to fossil fuels, their construction does involve certain environmental impacts, Sri Lanka Sustainable Energy Authority (SLSEA) Chairman Professor Wijendra Bandara acknowledged today.

title: UNP heads to roll
byline: The United National Party (UNP) is to get a new look with new faces coming into some positions soon, Party Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe announced today.

title: Pension Department restores IT system after cyberattack
byline: The Department of Pensions has announced that its information systems have been fully restored following a cyberattack in April.

title: Duminda Dissanayake further remanded
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake has been further remanded until June 5 in connection with a case involving the discovery of a firearm at an apartment complex in Havelock Town.

title: Nalin Fernando sentenced to 25 years rigorous imprisonment
byline: Former Lanka Sathosa Chairman Nalin Fernando was sentenced to 25 years rigorous imprisonment by a three-judge bench of the High Court today.

title: Mahindananda sentenced to 20 years rigorous imprisonment
byline: A three-judge bench of the High Court today sentenced former Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment.

title: Elon Musk leaves Trump administration
byline: Elon Musk has said he is leaving the Trump administration after helping lead a tumultuous drive to shrink the size of US government that saw thousands of federal jobs axed.

title: Shooting in Panadura leaves one injured
byline: A shooting incident was reported in the Wekada area of Panadura earlier today, according to police.

title: Trump administration to ’aggressively’ revoke visas of Chinese students
byline: US President Donald Trump’s administration says it will ’’aggressively’’ revoke the visas of Chinese students studying in the US.

title: US trade court blocks Trump’s sweeping tariffs
byline: A US federal court has blocked President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, in a major blow to a key part of his economic policies.

title: Venerable Bandarawela Amithananda Thera passes away
byline: Venerable Bandarawela Amithananda Thera, a respected and beloved preacher in Sri Lanka, passed away this afternoon while receiving treatment at the National Hospital Colombo (NHC).

title: Committee handling UNP helped secure 450,000 votes at LG polls
byline: The committee which handled the campaign on behalf of the United National Party (UNP) managed to secure 450,000 votes at the Local Government polls, party leader Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: PHIs urge timely registration of poson dansal
byline: The Public Health Inspectors’ (PHI) Union annouced that all dansals planned for the upcoming poson week must be register by June 7.

title: 24-hour passport service ends tomorrow
byline: The 24-hour one-day passport issuance service for the public will come to an end tomorrow (May 30), Acting Controller General of the Department of Immigration and Emigration, Chaminda Pathiraja said.

title: 16 OICs transferred
byline: A total of 16 Officers-in-Charge (OICs) of Police have been transferred and assigned to new postings with immediate effect.

title: Free vehicle tuning camp, awareness programme in Kegalle to mark World Environment Day
byline: In conjunction with World Environment Day, the Vehicle Emissions Trust Fund will organise a free motorcycle and three-wheeler tuning camp, along with an awareness programme on fuel efficiency and air pollution, on May 31, the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) said.

title: Lawyer complains to CID over release of 323 containers
byline: Nalin Sampath Kumara, a lawyer, has lodged a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to record statements from MP Dayasiri Jayasekara and former MP Udaya Gammanpila over the claims they have made over the release of 323 containers by the Sri Lanka Customs.

title: Is Govt. serious over higher education?
byline: Despite the country’s commitment to a free education system, the higher education sector is currently under severe strain with mounting concerns over its capacity and infrastructure.

title: Seven arrested with high accuracy metal detector at Silavathura roadblock
byline: A seven-member group of persons travelling in a double cab was arrested by Silavathura Police, while in possession of a high accuracy metal detector, police said.

title: Strong winds, rain expected across several provinces
byline: The Meteorological Department has issued a weather advisory warning of fairly strong winds and showers across multiple provinces in Sri Lanka due to the strengthening of South-West monsoonal conditions.

title: Man arrested for attempting to shoot fellow schoolmate in Negombo
byline: A 53-year-old man was arrested in Negombo for allegedly attempting to shoot a former schoolmate following an argument, police said.

title: Keheliya Rambukwella’s daughter appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Amali Rambukwella, the daughter of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today to provide a statement.

title: CSE closes strong with broad gains and robust turnover
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a strong positive note today, with increased market activity and steady investor buying. The positive trend was supported by strong company performances in the last quarter and growing investor confidence. Most sectors showed gains, reflecting overall market optimism.

title: Doctor arrested for sexual harassment
byline: A doctor operating a private medical centre and guest house in Unawatuna, Galle, has been arrested on suspicion of sexually harassing a 22-year-old woman employed at the medical centre.

title: Kandy declared high-risk area for Dengue
byline: Health authorities have raised alarms, warning that the Kandy District is now on the verge of becoming a high-risk area for Dengue fever as the number of reported cases continues to rise.

title: Court allows 7 days detention of suspects arrested over trafficking 778 kgs of heroin, ICE
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today granted permission to the Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB) to detain and interrogate 11 more suspects arrested while allegedly transporting approximately 778 kilograms of heroin and Crystal methamphetamine (ICE) by boat off the southern coast of Sri Lanka.

title: Grade 6 admissions appeal results for 2025 released
byline: The results of the first round of appeals for Grade 6 admissions in 2025, based on the 2024 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, have now been released, the Education Ministry said.

title: Anudi Gunasekara makes history for Sri Lanka at Miss World Festival
byline: In a landmark moment for Sri Lanka, Anudi Gunasekara etched her name into pageant history by claiming the title of First Runner-Up from Asia in the Miss World Multimedia Challenge at the 72nd Miss World Festival in the vibrant city of Telangana, India.

title: Recruitment of 190 locomotive engineers underway
byline: Applications have been called to recruit 190 locomotive engineers, including 160 external applicants and 30 from within the department, Railways General Manager Dhammika Jayasundara said.

title: Six suspects revealed to be directly involved in shooting at Thusitha Halloluwa
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) informed the court today that all six suspects arrested in connection with the recent shooting incident targeting Thusitha Halloluwa, the former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board, have been found to be directly involved in the crime.

title: Sri Lanka Women win relay bronze
byline: The Sri Lanka Women’s 4X400m Relay Team won the bronze medal on the third day of the 26th Asian Senior Athletic Championships, which continued in Gumi, South Korea.

title: Death sentence for murder of schoolboy
byline: A man charged with causing the death of a 16-year-old schoolboy by pushing him from a moving trishaw was found guilty of murder and sentenced to death by Badulla High Court Judge Prasanna Alwis.

title: Hazlewood helps Bengaluru thrash Punjab to reach IPL final
byline: Australia’s Josh Hazlewood returned figures of 3-21 to help Royal Challengers Bengaluru storm into the Indian Premier League final with a eight-wicket thrashing of Punjab Kings on Thursday.

title: Charred body with trishaw found in Rakwana
byline: A charred body with a badly burnt trishaw was found by police in Rakwana today

title: Customs speeds up vehicle clearance to one and a half days
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs said today that the delays in clearing imported vehicles have now been significantly reduced, with vehicles now being released within one and a half days, Additional Director General and Customs spokesperson Seevali Arukgoda said.

title: Group of Sri Lankans extradited from Kuwait
byline: A group of 30 Sri Lankans employees extradited from Kuwait for not possessing valid visas, arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport in the early hours of last morning.
